metadata.title: CVE-2022-48839 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/packet: fix slab-out-of-bounds access in packet_recvmsg()syzbot found that when an AF_PACKET socket is using PACKET_COPY_THRESHand mmap operations, tpacket_rcv() is queueing skbs withgarbage in skb->cb[], triggering a too big copy [1]Presumably, users of af_packet using mmap() already gets correctmetadata from the mapped buffer, we can simply make sureto clear 12 bytes that might be copied to user space later.BUG: KASAN: stack-out-of-bounds in memcpyinclude/linux/fortify-string.h:225 [inline]BUG:     by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-234.268~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1113.119').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1').
